data.text: @MartinJKeatings I know, if it actually affected them, then something might get done about it.
@Stand_Free83 No. You pay for that. It's subsidised for them because their home office is an expense.
@MartinJKeatings Guess they won't have to scrimp and scrape to pay the increased energy costs now, yay for grubby MPs
@MartinJKeatings Unbelievable plus relief on energy bills. It's almost like they cushion themselves from the decisions they make on behalf of the rest of us. Viva le revolution - soon!!.
